intro: Ornithogalum fergusoniae, commonly known as the Fergusons' star-of-Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a perennial herb characterized by its upright, grass-like leaves and clusters of white or pale blue star-shaped flowers. The plant typically blooms in spring and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is known for its ornamental value. Due to habitat loss, it is considered threatened in some regions.
